1.title: Nothing To Add 1/10 Noël
1.plot: Degrowth is a poorly known concept and yet, Noël, the first of the ten speakers of the series, proves to be already in this process.

2.title: Nothing to Add 2/10 Chantal
2.plot: Meet Chantal who never is at a loss for words to describe a world in which she no longer recognizes herself. When she does not long to die because of the disgust that the decadence of our time inspires her, she wants to make counterfeit money. What a woman.

3.title: Nothing to Add 3/10 Olivier
3.plot: Discover the 3rd episode of Nothing To Add. Olivier talks about globalization, questions the North-South gap and thinks about the nature of the human being in relation to the possibility of degrowth. A vacillating portrait, between light and shadow.

4.title: Nothing To Add 4/10 Valérie
4.plot: Discover the 4th episode of Nothing To Add. Valérie questions the necessity of growth, the meaning of degrowth, the end of capitalism, strung out as she says, and the need to give a real place to new ways of thinking the world. It is the testimony of a thoughtful, measured and implacable thought on the state of our world.

5.title: Nothing to Add 5/10 Philippe
5.plot: Discover the 5th episode of Nothing To Add. Philippe explains to us gently that the society of degrowth he wishes is not a society of recession (peculiar to capitalism) but rather a society of human wealth. And this requires the necessary involvement of everyone in politics, as Castoriadis so well said: "To oppose a culture of life to a political culture of death is a requirement of our time."

6.title: Nothing to Add 6/10 Charlyne
6.plot: Discover the 6th episode of Nothing To Add. Meet Charlyne who talks about revolution, Britney Spears kind of democracy and alternative education. The one that she received allowed her to develop an autonomous thought and to discuss with subtlety and confidence the tenets of the political society of our country. Exciting .

7.title: Nothing to Add 7/10 David
7.plot: Discover the 7th episode of Nothing To Add. Meet David who thinks of degrowth from a constructive point of view and who prefers words like freeing or emancipation, which sees the distribution of wealth as an ineluctable starting point, and which reflects on energy saving, among others. A rich portrait that addresses many important topics in this turbulent time.

imdb.plot outline: Nothing to add is a documentary series on Degrowth based on a sociological approach. It is a space of free expression, a citizen forum offered to non-specialists from french society. The participants unfold their thoughts without adding anything, without their word being distorted or interrupted. A political space in the noble sense of the word that takes the party to trust the spectators; its analytical capacity and critical mind. What is Degrowth? Is it important? Is it possible? How to set it up? Answers are provided, episode after episode, anchored in the lived reality of the speakers.
imdb.title: Nothing to Add: Degrowth
plot: Nothing to add is a documentary series on Degrowth based on a sociological approach. It is a space of free expression, a citizen forum offered to non-specialists from french society.::Clémence Le Prévost
